# init(array:range:copyItems:)

**Initializer**

Initializes a newly allocated set with the objects that are contained in the specified range of an array, optionally copying the items.

## Declaration

```swift
convenience init(array set: [Any], range: NSRange, copyItems flag: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **set**: An array of objects to add to the new set.

If the same object appears more than once in array, it is represented only once in the returned ordered set.
- **range**: The range of objects in `array` to add to the ordered set.
- **flag**: If [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] the objects are copied to the ordered set; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Return Value

An initialized ordered set containing a uniqued collection of the objects contained in specified range of the array.

## Initializing an Ordered Set

- **init(array:)**: Initializes a newly allocated set with the objects that are contained in a given array.
- **init(array:copyItems:)**: Initializes a newly allocated set with the objects that are contained in a given array, optionally copying the items.
- **init(object:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the object.
- **init(objects:count:)**: Initializes a newly allocated set with a specified number of objects from a given C array of objects.
- **init(orderedSet:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the contents of a set.
- **init(orderedSet:copyItems:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the contents of a set, optionally copying the items.
- **init(orderedSet:range:copyItems:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the contents of an ordered set, optionally copying the items.
- **init(set:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the contents of a set.
- **init(set:copyItems:)**: Initializes a new ordered set with the contents of a set, optionally copying the objects in the set.
- **init()**: Initializes a newly allocated ordered set.
